intro: Anchusa oppositifolia, commonly known as the common blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Anchusa oppositifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
